DataElement.preferredName: Immunohistochemical Bioassay Procedure Specimen Size Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field used to capture the minimum type or physical magnitude of a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Immunohistochemical Test Bioassay Intervention or Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope._A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)_An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.:A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.
A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free-text field used to capture the physical magnitude of a specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Size; the physical magnitude of something.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
